attributes.action: Protect Badger Foraging Land - S.10/790 ref planning reference 51/02/00015
attributes.additional_details:
There is a legal Deed of Covenant dated 22nd October 2003 between Beazer Homes Ltd & Sedgemoor District Council to “Badger Foraging Site” land forming part of the land registered under the title number ST120570 contains the following Covenants:-

1. Not to use the Badger Foraging Area for any purpose save as an open space an badger protection area.

2. Not to erect any building whether of a permanent or temporary nature or carry out any development upon the Badger Foraging Land
We must stop any development on the Badger Foraging Land as any development will set a president allowing further development and the loss of a protected wildlife habitat forever!
attributes.background:
Wembdon Parish Council intend to start installing pathways, lighting and cctv around the land on 16th September.
Urgent Action Required. Save the Wembdon Badgers, Bats, Hedgehogs & Wildlife!

rejection.details:
This is a local planning matter. You could raise the issue with local councillors who represent you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, here:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Your MP might be able to raise the issue on your behalf. You can find your local MP here:

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/
